content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word

content.question: Maria consecrated her energies to creating health care for everyone.
My only clue about what was bothering him was the one allusion he made to his job.
Speeding in neighborhoods at night without headlights shows a wanton disregard for the safety of people who may be walking.
The conqueror sought subjugation of the conquered.
Tasneem exhorted her friends not to smoke.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word

content.question: Martin’s mother worried about her feckless son.
He presented the corsage in a stilted manner.
The wanton kittens found homes quickly.
Maureen found that the trick to babysitting was to dote on the children.
Nathan’s pensive moods never last long.

content.section_header: Choose the best way to complete each sentence or answer each question

content.question: Someone implicated in a crime is likely to be
Which of the following least describes dissemination?
“The trauma of being orphaned as a child” describes what kind of shock?
Which of the following is least likely to be a lamentation?
Monetary is least likely to describe

passage: Diana, Princess of Wales, died on August 31, 1997, as the result of a traumatic car accident. Her public life as a princess was filled with grandeur, pomp, and ceremony, but her private life was known to be troubled. Following her divorce from Prince Charles, she remained beloved by the British people and had millions of fans and followers worldwide. She had a significant impact on the world of fashion and in popular culture that extended beyond her role as a member of royalty. On the day of her funeral, thousands of people lined the streets lamenting her sudden death, at age thirty-six, with an incredible outpouring of sorrow. Although tabloid newspapers alluded to murder as the reason for her death, it was discovered later that it was nothing but a tragic accident, rather than a wanton act of violence.

content.question: In line 2, traumatic means
The meaning of pomp (line 3) is
The word lamenting (line 10) most nearly means
The phrase alluded to (line 12) means
The word wanton (line 14) most nearly means
